sentences.english: Chen Cheng, army chief of staff, declared the war would soon be over.
sentences.chinese: 蒋军参谋总长陈诚声言战争不久即可结束。

sentences.english: Juliet tossed her head, and said she would never marry him.
sentences.chinese: 朱丽叶轻蔑地把头一仰，声言她绝不会嫁给他。

sentences.english: YiXin tore up the contract in public, and that ended the cooperation with letters.
sentences.chinese: 毅昕当众把合约撕毁，且声言结束与信佳的合作。

sentences.english: He went out on a limb when he declared his support for the legalization of prostitution.
sentences.chinese: 他声言支持娼妓合法化，定会遭人抨击。

sentences.english: He affirmed his loyalty to his country.
sentences.chinese: 他声言忠于自己的国家。

definition: to put about (a story, plan, threat etc)/to let it be known (esp. of threat or malicious story)/to threaten
to call loudly (idiom); to get people's attention/to make one's views known
to deliver/to send a letter/a letter (of complaint, opinion etc)
to criticize harshly/to denounce/to attack viciously
to say clearly/to argue clearly/to pronounce/pronounced
to punish (someone)/to take disciplinary action against (someone)
to launch an all-out attack (idiom)/to roundly condemn/to castigate
to launch a punitive campaign/to condemn scathingly
